record.bridgyOriginalText:
how to get there is a little hidden right now but it's all public: https://github.com/elastic/kibana/blob/main/x-pack/platform/plugins/shared/onechat/README.md

on elasticsearch serverless it's already available (in other deployment options soon). you need to enable a couple of feature flags for it and then you're good to go:
POST kbn://internal/kibana/settings
{
"changes": {
"onechat:mcp:enabled": true,
"onechat:a2a:enabled": true,
"onechat:api:enabled": true,
"onechat:ui:enabled": true
}
}

external.title: Original post on mastodon.social

TIL: You can take a full-page screenshot in Chrome without an extension!

1. Open DevTools (Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + I).
2. Open the Command Menu (Ctrl/Cmd + Shift + P).
3. Type "screenshot" and select "Capture full size screenshot."

#ChromeDevTools #WebDev #ProTip

external.description: Planning for your period might be difficult if long covid has made it last longer SeventyFour Images / Alamy Long covid seems to disrupt the menstrual cycle, making periods heavier and longer. This may come about because of lingering covid-19-related complications that alter levels of hormones or cause inflammation. Why long covid occurs is unclear – studies suggest it may result from the virus lurking at low levels in the body, the immune system misfiring or even disruption to the gut microbiome.

external.description: NASA and its partners recently tested a tool for remotely piloted operations that could enable operators to transport people and goods more efficiently within urban areas.   The team’s goal is to ensure that when these remotely piloted aircraft – including electric vertical takeoff and landing vehicles (eVTOLs) – take to the skies, air traffic controllers won’t be overburdened by increased flight operations and safety is maintained across the national airspace.

external.description: Analysis of the Texts Allegedly Made by Tyler Robinson  Based on the available information from court documents and prosecutorial announcements related to the case against Tyler Robinson (the 22-year-old suspect in the shooting death of conservative activist Charlie Kirk on September 10, 2025), the U.S. Department of Justice (in coordination with Utah County prosecutors and the FBI) has referenced several text messages and digital communications attributed to Robinson. These were primarily exchanged with his roommate/romantic partner (a transgender individual) and include Discord messages shown to investigators. The full exchanges were detailed in charging documents released on September 16, 2025, and covered extensively in media reports.  I'll first summarize the key texts provided in these sources, then analyze whether they appear to be written by AI. My assessment draws on common hallmarks of AI-generated text (e.g., from models like GPT-series), such as overly formal or repetitive phrasing, lack of personal idiosyncrasies, generic vocabulary, unnatural emotional flow, or formulaic structure. Human writing, especially in high-stress personal confessions, often includes slang, typos, emotional volatility, cultural references, and concise or fragmented sentences.  Key Texts Attributed to Tyler Robinson The texts are informal, confessional, and planning-oriented, sent via SMS and Discord in the days leading up to and immediately after the shooting. Here's a compilation of the most directly quoted or described excerpts from the Justice Department-linked court filings (as reported):  Pre-Shooting Planning (to Roommate via Text/Discord):    "I had the opportunity to take out Charlie Kirk and I'm going to take it." (Note left under keyboard, referenced in text: "Drop what you are doing, look under my keyboard.")    "If I am able to grab my rifle unseen, I will have left no evidence."    "Going to attempt to retrieve it again..." (Referring to the rifle.)    References to a "drop point" for the rifle, instructions to "retrieve and hide the weapon," and discussions of "engraving bullets" (e.g., with memes like "hey fascist! CATCH!" or "O bella ciao, bella ciao, bella ciao, ciao, ciao!"—an anti-fascist anthem—and gaming references like "notices bulges OwO what's this?").  Post-Shooting Confession (to Roommate via Text):    In response to roommate's question: "You weren’t the one who did it, right????" → "I am."    "Why did I do it? I had enough of his hatred."    "Some hate can't be negotiated out."    Sarcastic comment about bullet engravings: (Implying the roommate would) "have a stroke" if Fox News had to explain the memes on air.  Obstruction/Witness Tampering (to Roommate via Text):    Instructions to delete messages: "Told his roommate to delete their post-shooting messages."    "Instructed the roommate to avoid speaking to police."    Additional context: Robinson allegedly pressured the roommate to stay silent and discard evidence like clothing.  Other Post-Shooting Communications (Discord Group Chat with Friends):    When tagged in a chat about a suspect photo resembling him: Replied within a minute joking about his "doppelganger" trying to "get me in trouble."    Response to jesting message "Tyler killed Charlie!!!!": Engaged in the banter, showing awareness of news coverage.  These texts were obtained from the roommate's devices and used as evidence in the seven felony charges, including aggravated murder, obstruction of justice, and witness tampering. Prosecutors noted Robinson spent over a week planning, and the messages confirm targeting Kirk over "political expression" and "hatred."  Do These Texts Appear to Be Written by AI? No, the texts do not appear to be written by AI. They exhibit strong characteristics of authentic, human-authored personal communications, particularly from a young adult (22 years old) in a high-stress, emotional context. Here's a structured breakdown of why they read as human-generated, contrasted with typical AI traits:  | Aspect | Human Indicators in Robinson's Texts | Typical AI Hallmarks (Absent Here) | Explanation | |--------|-------------------------------------|------------------------------------|-------------| | Phrasing and Structure | Short, fragmented sentences (e.g., "I am." as a blunt confession); direct imperatives (e.g., "Drop what you are doing"); casual planning notes (e.g., "Going to attempt to retrieve it again..."). | Overly polished, complete sentences; repetitive structures or filler phrases (e.g., "It is important to note that..."). | AI text often feels essay-like or explanatory, even in casual modes. These are terse and stream-of-consciousness, like real-time texting under duress. No unnatural expansions or hedges. | | Emotional Tone and Volatility | Mix of defiance ("Some hate can't be negotiated out"), sarcasm (joking about Fox News "having a stroke"), and raw motivation ("I had enough of his hatred"). Post-shooting banter in group chats shows dark humor. | Neutral, balanced, or overly empathetic tone; avoids extreme emotions unless prompted. | Human confessions in crimes often blend anger, justification, and levity (e.g., meme references). AI struggles with authentic emotional inconsistency without specific guidance. | | Vocabulary and Slang | Informal abbreviations (implied in "wya" from chats); niche cultural refs (e.g., "OwO" from furry/gaming memes, "bella ciao" anthem, "copypasta" trolling). Sarcasm tied to subcultures. | Generic or formal words; rare unprompted slang unless trained on it. Avoids obscure internet humor. | The bullet engravings and jokes (e.g., "hey fascist! CATCH!") are steeped in online/gaming communities, which a human like Robinson (a former Utah State student with concurrent enrollment) would naturally use. AI might mimic this if prompted but rarely originates such specific, edgy references organically. | | Contextual Relevance and Personalization | Highly specific to the event (e.g., targeting Kirk's "hatred," rifle details from grandfather's unique weapon, DNA on trigger). References real-time actions (hiding evidence, deleting texts). | Vague or generalized content; hallucinations or inconsistencies if not fact-checked. | Texts align perfectly with forensic evidence (e.g., DNA, shell casings with inscriptions). AI-generated fakes might invent details inconsistently, but these feel lived-in and evidentiary. | | Errors and Idiosyncrasies | No reported typos, but the raw, unedited feel (e.g., ellipsis for trailing thoughts) suggests unpolished human input. Joke about "doppelganger" shows quick, reactive wit. | Often error-free but stiff; may include unnatural repetitions or overly correct grammar. | Real texts from stressed individuals can be imperfect; AI is typically too "clean" for panicked confessions. The sarcasm and timing (replying in a minute) indicate live human interaction. | | Overall Coherence and Purpose | Focused on confession, planning, and cover-up; builds a narrative of premeditation without fluff. | May ramble or add irrelevant details; struggles with concise, plot-driven personal stories. | These serve a clear criminal intent (e.g., tampering), which humans execute pragmatically. AI text in a similar prompt might over-explain motives philosophically. |  Additional Context and Substantiation Source Reliability: The texts come from official court affidavits and announcements by Utah County Attorney Jeff Gray, supported by FBI analysis (e.g., DNA matches, shell casings). No media or official reports suggest AI involvement or fabrication; instead, they emphasize the messages as direct evidence of guilt. No Evidence of AI Use: Searches for connections between Robinson and AI tools (e.g., ChatGPT) yield nothing. His background (college student, gamer) doesn't indicate AI expertise, and the content's subcultural depth (memes, Discord) points to personal authorship. Potential for AI Detection Tools: If analyzed by tools like GPTZero or Originality.ai, these texts would likely score as human due to brevity, specificity, and emotional irregularity. AI detectors flag long-form, neutral content more easily. Caveats: Without the absolute verbatim transcripts (media quotes are partial), a 100% certainty isn't possible, but the described content strongly suggests human origin. If full documents were available, forensic linguistic analysis (e.g., stylometry) could confirm further.  In summary, these texts read as genuine human communications—intense, culturally embedded, and purposeful—rather than the more contrived output typical of AI. They align with patterns seen in real criminal confessions, reinforcing their authenticity in the legal context.

An enchanting anime-style illustration of a young girl standing in a vibrant flower field under a full moon. She has long, golden-blonde hair tied into two ponytails with pink ribbons, her bangs neatly framing her soft face. Her large, expressive eyes are a gentle shade of pink-purple, giving her an innocent and dreamy look. She wears an elegant, pure white off-shoulder dress with delicate frills around the neckline and waist, the fabric appearing soft and flowing, slightly translucent at the hem as if touched by moonlight. Her bare arms rest naturally at her sides, and her small hands are relaxed, enhancing her calm and serene demeanor.

The setting is a lush meadow filled with blooming cosmos flowers in shades of pink, magenta, and white, their petals glowing softly in the moonlight. The background reveals a dramatic night sky, with a radiant full moon shining brightly amidst drifting gray clouds, casting a mystical glow across the scene. The illumination creates gentle shadows on her dress and highlights her hair with silver-like reflections. The perspective is frontal, focusing on the girl at the center, surrounded by the colorful sea of flowers.

The overall mood is magical, tranquil, and slightly melancholic, evoking a dreamlike summer night atmosphere. The art style is  soft gradients, and vibrant colors, yet it conveys a poetic and emotional tone with strong emphasis on moonlight, flowers, and innocence.

日本語のプロンプト: 幻想的なアニメ風のイラスト。満月の下、花畑に立つ少女が描かれている。彼女は金色がかったブロンドの長い髪を持ち、左右に二つのポニーテールに結ばれ、ピンクのリボンで飾られている。前髪は整っており、柔らかな顔立ちを縁取っている。瞳は大きく表情豊かで、ピンクがかった紫色をしており、無邪気さと夢見るような雰囲気を漂わせている。彼女の衣装は純白のオフショルダーのドレスで、胸元とウエストに繊細なフリルが施されており、生地は柔らかく流れるようで、裾は月明かりに透けるような印象を与える。裸の腕は自然に横に下ろされ、小さな手はリラックスした状態で、穏やかな雰囲気を強調している。

背景はピンク、マゼンタ、白のコスモスが咲き乱れる草原で、花びらは月光を受けて柔らかく輝いている。夜空には輝く満月が浮かび、流れる灰色の雲に囲まれ、幻想的な光を全体に投げかけている。その光はドレスに柔らかな影を落とし、髪に銀色のような反射を与えている。構図は正面からで、中央に立つ少女を囲むように花々が広がっている。

全体の雰囲気は魔法的で静謐、やや切なさを感じさせる夢のような夏の夜の情景。アートスタイルは柔らかなグラデーションと鮮やかな色彩によって詩的で感情的なトーンを持ち、月光、花、そして無垢さを強調している。

英語のプロンプト(カンマ区切り): anime-style girl, standing in a vibrant flower field full of pink and white cosmos flowers, night scene with a large glowing full moon in the sky, scattered dark clouds partially covering the moon, mysterious and serene atmosphere, long blonde hair tied into twin ponytails with pink ribbon bows, straight bangs, large pink eyes with a gentle yet melancholic expression, wearing an off-shoulder white dress with delicate ruffled details, flowing skirt with frayed hem, soft moonlight illuminating her figure, high-detail anime illustration, clean outlines, soft shading, magical and dreamlike mood, fantasy-inspired setting

external.description:
A Câmara dos Deputados aprovou na noite desta terça-feira a chamada PEC da Blindagem, proposta que dificulta a prisão e a abertura de ações penais contra parlamentares, além de ampliar o alcance do foro privilegiado para incluir presidentes de partidos. O texto, aprovado por 353 votos a 134, foi entregue a líderes de bancadas nesta manhã e entrou na pauta do plenário.
A proposta que vai ser levada à votação inclui um dispositivo que permite aos parlamentares derrubarem uma prisão em flagrante de um de seus pares. Nessas situações, caberá à Casa Legislativa respectiva — Câmara ou Senado — decidir se mantém ou não a medida. Caso seja indeferido, a prescrição do processo ficará suspensa durante o exercício do mandato.
Veja como votou cada deputado
external.title: PEC da Blindagem: veja como votou cada deputado

external.description: The provided sources chronicle the tragic murder of Jimmy Pearson, a successful Oregon pawn shop owner, in March 2021. They detail the discovery of his body in his lavish mansion, revealing a single gunshot wound and signs of robbery. The episode describe the ensuing investigation, which quickly focused on Nistasha Rose Tate after a suspicious text message was found on Pearson's phone, ultimately leading to her arrest and conviction for second-degree murder and first-degree robbery. Furthermore, the texts examine the complexities of Pearson's personal life, including a strained relationship with his daughters and a controversial decision to disinherit them, which ignited a separate legal battle over his significant $10 million estate. Finally, the sources reflect on the broader implications of the case, touching upon the vulnerability of business owners in cash-heavy industries and the intricate interplay of wealth, loneliness, and personal relationships.

external.description: This extensive epsiode chronicles the tragic 2014 murder of Chinelle Browne, a 27-year-old Guyanese immigrant and mother of four, by her neighbor Leah Cuevas in Brooklyn, New York. It details how a dispute over unpaid rent escalated into a brutal attack, leading to Browne being stabbed numerous times, dismembered, and her remains scattered across Long Island. The narrative follows the investigation, the overwhelming evidence pointing to Cuevas, her subsequent conviction and sentencing to 25 years to life, and the profound impact on Browne's family and community. Furthermore, the source compares this crime to other dismemberment cases in the area, highlighting the media and public reaction to such heinous acts.

record.text: 📣 New Podcast! "Movie Star and Visionary Robert Redford has Died at Age 89" on @Spreaker #golbalnews #newspodcast #redford #robert

external.description: The episode offers a comprehensive look at the life and legacy of Robert Redford, a towering figure in cinema and a dedicated activist, who passed away in 2025 at the age of 89. It explores his early life and rise to stardom, highlighting his versatile acting career in iconic films like Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid and All the President's Men. The source also details his significant contributions as a visionary director, earning an Oscar for Ordinary People, and his most enduring achievement: founding the Sundance Institute and Film Festival, which revolutionized independent cinema. Finally, the text underscores Redford's lifelong commitment to environmental advocacy and social causes, alongside aspects of his personal life, ultimately cementing his multifaceted impact on culture and the film industry.
